sentences.text: On 26 July 2023, a coup d'état occurred in Niger when the country's presidential guard detained President Mohamed Bazoum, and Presidential Guard commander General officer|General Abdourahamane Tchiani proclaimed himself the leader of a new military National Council for the Safeguard of the Homeland|junta, shortly after confirming the coup a success.<ref name="ajtchiani" />

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |date=26 July 2023 |title=Niger : ce que l'on sait de la tentative de coup d'Etat en cours contre le président Mohamed Bazoum |trans-title=Niger: what we know about the ongoing coup attempt against President Mohamed Bazoum |url=https://www.francetvinfo.fr/monde/afrique/niger/niger-ce-que-l-on-sait-de-la-tentative-de-coup-d-etat-en-cours-contre-le-president-mohamed-bazoum_5973206.html |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230726202029/https://www.francetvinfo.fr/monde/afrique/niger/niger-ce-que-l-on-sait-de-la-tentative-de-coup-d-etat-en-cours-contre-le-president-mohamed-bazoum_5973206.html |archive-date=26 July 2023 |access-date=9 August 2023 |website=Franceinfo |language=fr-FR}}</ref>
<ref>{{Cite news |date=26 July 2023 |title=Niger soldiers declare coup on national TV |language=en-GB |work=BBC |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-66320895 |access-date=28 July 2023}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |title=Niger's president 'held by guards' in apparent coup attempt |date=28 July 2023 |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/7/26/soldiers-holding-niger-president-inside-palace-security-sources |access-date=9 August 2023 |website=Al Jazeera |language=en}}</ref>

sentences.text: This was the fifth military coup d'état since the country gained independence from France in 1960, and the first since 2010 Nigerien coup d'état|2010. The coup was condemned by the United States and France, and by the West African regional bloc ECOWAS, the latter of which threatened military intervention against the junta, leading to the Nigerien crisis (2023–2024)|2023–2024 Niger crisis.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |title=Timeline: A history of coups in Niger |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/7/27/timeline-a-history-of-coups-in-niger |date=27 July 2023 |website=Al Jazeera |access-date=9 August 2023 |language=en}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |first=Daramola |last=Luke |date=4 August 2023 |title=Is ECOWAS set to take on Niger militarily? |url=https://theinformant247.com/is-ecowas-set-to-take-on-niger-militarily/ |access-date=9 August 2023 |website=The Informant247 |language=en-US}}</ref>

sentences.text:
{{further|2021 Nigerien coup d'état attempt}}
Niger had previously undergone four military coups since History of Niger#Independence|independence from France in 1960, with the most recent having occurred in 2010 Nigerien coup d'état|2010. In between, there were also several coup attempts, the most recent of which was in 2021 Nigerien coup d'état attempt|2021 when military dissidents tried to seize the presidential palace two days before the inauguration of president-elect Mohamed Bazoum.{{efn|group=L|In March 2023, a Nigerien official alleged that another coup attempt was made while Bazoum was in Turkey, although the government refused to comment.

references.text: <ref name="f24"/>}} He was the country's first democratically elected president to assume office from a similarly elected predecessor. The coup also came in the wake of recent coups in nearby countries, such as in 2021 Guinean coup d'état|Guinea, 2021 Malian coup d'état|Mali, and 2021 Sudan coup d'état|Sudan in 2021, and two in Burkina Faso in January 2022 Burkina Faso coup d'état|January and September 2022 Burkina Faso coup d'état|September 2022, which has led to the region being called a "coup belt".<ref name="aj1">{{Cite web |date=26 July 2023 |title=Niger's Bazoum 'held by guards' in apparent coup attempt |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/7/26/soldiers-holding-niger-president-inside-palace-security-sources |access-date=27 July 2023 |website=Al Jazeera |language=en-US |archive-date=27 July 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230727002123/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/7/26/soldiers-holding-niger-president-inside-palace-security-sources |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: Niger is a member of ECOWAS, which has already suspended Guinea, Mali and Burkina Faso from membership due to successful coups in recent years. Bola Tinubu, President of Nigeria, was appointed Chairman of ECOWAS on 9 July 2023 and warned that they will not allow another coup in the region and would take up these issues with the African Union and Western countries.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |last=Okafor |first=Chiamaka |date=10 July 2023 |title=We will not tolerate coups in West Africa – Tinubu |url=https://www.premiumtimesng.com/news/headlines/608962-we-will-not-tolerate-coups-in-west-africa-tinubu.html |access-date=30 July 2023 |website=Premium Times Nigeria |language=en-GB}}</ref>

sentences.text: Analysts cite the rising cost of living and perceptions of government "incompetence", as well as Bazoum's plans to replace the head of the presidential guard, General Abdourahmane Tchiani as possible triggers for the coup.

references.text: <ref name="aj1"/><ref>{{Cite web |title=The coup in Niger |url=https://www.iiss.org/publications/strategic-comments/2023/the-coup-in-niger/ |access-date=2023-08-21 |website=IISS |language=en}}</ref>

sentences.text: The country frequently ranks at the bottom of the UN's Human Development Index It was also stated that disputes with the army over attitudes with ECOWAS' position on military juntas in the region may have also played a part; Salifou Modi, Chief of staff of Niger Armed Forces|Niger's military until 31 March 2023, visited Bamako in March to agree with Mali that it could pursue jihadists on Malian territory, but Bazoum was supportive of ECOWAS in its anti-junta stance; Modi was replaced a few weeks later. Coup leader Abdourahamane Tchiani stated that the Nigerien military overthrew Bazoum due to rising insecurity in regard to jihadism, but jihadist violence was decreasing at the time of the coup.

references.text: <ref name="f24" /> and has also suffered from Jihadist insurgency in Niger|Islamist insurgencies led by Al-Qaeda, Islamic State and Boko Haram,<ref name="bbc1" /> despite its military receiving training and logistical support from the United States, France and Turkey, which have bases in the country.<ref name="Rich">{{Cite news |first=David |last=Rich |date=18 February 2022 |work=France 24 |title=Niger becomes France's partner of last resort after Mali withdrawal |url=https://www.france24.com/en/africa/20220218-niger-becomes-france-s-partner-of-last-resort-after-mali-withdrawal |access-date=9 August 2023 |language=en |archive-date=26 July 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230726161918/https://www.france24.com/en/africa/20220218-niger-becomes-france-s-partner-of-last-resort-after-mali-withdrawal |url-status=live }}</ref>
<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.timesaerospace.aero/features/defence/why-african-militaries-now-want-to-talk-turkey|date=3 May 2022|title=Why African militaries now want to talk Turkey}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite journal|title=A coup foretold but not averted|volume=64|issue=16|date=3 August 2023|access-date=4 August 2023|journal=Africa Confidential|url=https://www.africa-confidential.com/article/id/14543/A_coup_foretold_but_not_averted}}</ref>

<ref name="Niger coup leaders blamed insecurity">{{Cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/niger-coup-leaders-blamed-insecurity-conflict-data-paints-different-picture-2023-08-03/|title=Niger coup leaders blamed insecurity; conflict data paints a different picture|work=Reuters|date=3 August 2023|last=Mcallister|first=Edward|access-date=4 August 2023}}</ref>

sentences.text: In 2022, the country became the hub of France's anti-jihadist operations in the Sahel region following its expulsion from Mali and Burkina Faso, with Bazoum being described as one of the few remaining pro-Western leaders in the region. US military investments in Niger include nearly 1,100 soldiers, drones, a secret CIA base, and millions of dollars in aid.

references.text: <ref name="f24" /> Niger became a key ally for Western, particularly French, American, and Turkish forces. With multiple coups and rising anti-French sentiments in the region, Niger became France's partner of last resort.<ref name="Rich" /> American-trained officers were also reported to have trained many members of the presidential guard.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Turse |first=Nick |date=26 July 2023 |title=Soldiers Mutiny in U.S.-Allied Niger |url=https://production.public.theintercept.cloud/2023/07/26/niger-coup-us-military/ |access-date= |website=The Intercept |language=en-US}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |last=Pierson |first=Elisabeth |date=8 August 2023 |title=Drones, base secrète de la CIA, millions de dollars d'aide... Pourquoi les Américains sont au premier plan au Niger |trans-title=Drones, secret CIA base, millions of dollars in aid... Why the Americans are at the forefront in Niger |url=https://www.lefigaro.fr/international/drones-base-secrete-de-la-cia-millions-de-dollars-d-aide-pourquoi-les-americains-sont-au-premier-plan-au-niger-20230808 |access-date=9 August 2023 |website=Le Figaro |language=fr}}</ref>

<ref name="reuters.com">{{Cite news |last1=Ali |first1=Idrees |last2=Psaledakis |first2=Daphne |last3=Ali |first3=Idrees |date=10 August 2023 |title=US military mission in Niger in focus after coup |language=en |work=Reuters |url=https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/us-military-mission-niger-focus-after-coup-2023-08-10/ |access-date=10 August 2023}}</ref>

sentences.text: At the same time, along with anti-French sentiment, a current of thought favorable to the entry of Russian influence and the Wagner Group mercenary company began to grow. Russia, through Wagner, has been gaining ground at the expense of the French in the region, following the latest coups in Mali and Burkina Faso. At the same time, Turkey has also expanded its influence.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web|url=https://english.alarabiya.net/News/world/2023/03/16/Mali-s-junta-gets-warplanes-drones-from-Russia-Turkey|title=Mali's junta gets warplanes, drones from Russia, Turkey|work=al-Arabiya |date=16 March 2023 }}</ref>

sentences.text:
, who was President of Niger from 2021 until the 2023 coup]]
Early in the morning, the President of Niger|Nigerien presidency's Twitter account announced that presidential guards,}} engaged in an "anti-Republican demonstration" and tried "in vain" to obtain the support of the other security forces.

references.text: <ref name="aj1"/> commanded by General Abdourahamane Tchiani<ref name="reuters"/>{{efn|group=L|Known as "Omar Tchiani" before his given name was given out in his public appearance following the coup.<ref>{{cite news |author1=Tchima Illa Issoufou |author2=Lucy Fleming |title=Niger coup: President Mohamed Bazoum in good health, says France |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-66324875 |date=28 July 2023 |location=Niamey |work=BBC |access-date=28 July 2023}}</ref>

<ref name="aj1"/> It also said that President Mohamed Bazoum and his family were well after reports emerged that he was being held in the Presidential Palace, Niamey|Presidential Palace in the capital, Niamey.<ref name="aj1"/> Interior Minister Hamadou Souley was also arrested and held in the palace, while roughly twenty members of the Presidential Guard were spotted outside later in the day.<ref name="cnn1"/> The coup was reportedly led by Tchiani, whom analysts said Bazoum had planned to relieve from his position.<ref name="ap2"/> Sources close to President Bazoum said that he had decided on Tchiani's dismissal at a cabinet meeting on 24 July as their relations had reportedly become strained.<ref name="gulf2">{{Cite web |date=29 July 2023 |title=Niger army general declares himself country's new leader |url=https://gulfnews.com/world/africa/niger-army-general-declares-himself-countrys-new-leader-1.1690598862297 |access-date=29 July 2023 |website=Gulf News}}</ref>

sentences.text: Bazoum's wife, Hadiza, and son, Salem, were detained with him at the presidential palace,

references.text: <ref name=jafrique/> while his daughters were in Paris at the time of the coup.<ref name=jafrique>{{cite news |first=Mathieu |last=Olivier |title=Au Niger, l'armée affirme avoir renversé Mohamed Bazoum |trans-title=In Niger, the army claims to have overthrown Mohamed Bazoum |url=https://www.jeuneafrique.com/1467524/politique/au-niger-larmee-affirme-avoir-renverse-mohamed-bazoum/ |work=Jeune Afrique |publisher= |date=27 July 2023 |access-date=27 July 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230727180229/https://www.jeuneafrique.com/1467524/politique/au-niger-larmee-affirme-avoir-renverse-mohamed-bazoum/ |archive-date=27 July 2023 |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: Bazoum and his family were still in detention in mid-November 2023, reportedly with little food, water, or electricity.

references.text: <ref name="lemondeeng">{{cite news |first=Morgane|last=La Cam |title=Niger: Concerns over fate of overthrown president and his family |url=https://www.lemonde.fr/en/le-monde-africa/article/2023/08/12/niger-concerns-over-fate-of-overthrown-president-and-his-family_6090620_124.html |work=Le Monde |publisher= |date=2023-08-12 |access-date=2023-08-14 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230812163415/https://www.lemonde.fr/en/le-monde-africa/article/2023/08/12/niger-concerns-over-fate-of-overthrown-president-and-his-family_6090620_124.html |archive-date=2023-08-12 |url-status=live}}</ref>

sentences.text: In the morning the palace and adjacent ministries were blocked off by military vehicles and palace staff were prevented from accessing their offices. of Bazoum tried to approach the palace, but were dispersed by the Presidential Guard with gunfire, leaving one injured. Elsewhere in Niamey, the situation was described as calm.<ref name="aj1"/> The Presidency also claimed that protests in support of Bazoum had occurred around the country's overseas diplomatic missions.<ref name="cnn1"/>

references.text: <ref name="aj1"/> Up to 400 civilian supporters<ref name="cnn1">{{cite web |last1=Dean |first1=Sarah |last2=Kennedy |first2=Niamh |last3=Madowo |first3=Larry |date=26 July 2023 |title=Niger soldiers claim President Mohamed Bazoum has been ousted, deepening coup fears |url=https://edition.cnn.com/2023/07/26/africa/niger-presidency-attempted-coup-intl/index.html |access-date=27 July 2023 |website=CNN |archive-date=26 July 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230726233540/https://edition.cnn.com/2023/07/26/africa/niger-presidency-attempted-coup-intl/index.html |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: In response to these events, Niger's armed forces surrounded the presidential palace in support of Bazoum. The Army also issued a statement saying they had secured "major strategic points" in the country. The Presidency stated that the Army and the National Guard of Niger|National Guard were ready to attack the presidential guard. The BBC also reported that loyalist forces had surrounded the state broadcaster ORTN. The US embassy warned against travel along Niamey's Boulevard de la Republique,<ref name="cnn1"/> where the Presidential Palace was located.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite news |last=Pilling |first=David |date=26 July 2023 |title=Niger president caught in attempted coup but armed forces rally in support |work=Financial Times |url=https://www.ft.com/content/1b5c843d-a814-4811-9eb2-0a66880ac779 |access-date=26 July 2023 |archive-date=26 July 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230726134331/https://www.ft.com/content/1b5c843d-a814-4811-9eb2-0a66880ac779 |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref name="bbc1">{{Cite news |last1=Minjibir |first1=Usman |last2=Macaulay |first2=Cecilia |date=26 July 2023 |title=Niger coup attempt: President Mohamed Bazoum held |work=BBC |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-66312011 |access-date=26 July 2023 |archive-date=26 July 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230726115806/https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-66312011 |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: In the evening, Niger Air Force|Air Force Amadou Abdramane went on state television channel Télé Sahel to claim that Bazoum had been removed from power and announced the formation of a National Council for the Safeguard of the Homeland.

references.text: <ref name="ap1"/> Colonel-Major<ref>{{cite web |title=Coup d'Etat au Niger : Les militaires putschistes suspendent " toutes les institutions " et ferment les frontières |trans-title=Coup d'etat in Niger: The putschist soldiers suspend "all the institutions" and close the borders |url=https://www.20minutes.fr/monde/4047077-20230727-coup-etat-niger-militaires-putschistes-suspendent-toutes-institutions-ferment-frontieres |website=20 minutes (France)|20 minutes |access-date=26 July 2023 |language=fr |archive-date=26 July 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230726234314/https://www.20minutes.fr/monde/4047077-20230727-coup-etat-niger-militaires-putschistes-suspendent-toutes-institutions-ferment-frontieres |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref name="ap1">{{cite web |last=Mednick |first=Sam |date=27 July 2023 |title=Mutinous soldiers claim to have overthrown Niger's president |url=https://apnews.com/article/niger-tensions-presidential-guard-96f8f63b838af5467d4c95ba7b998b32 |access-date=27 July 2023 |website=Associated Press|AP |archive-date=27 July 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230727003212/https://apnews.com/article/niger-tensions-presidential-guard-96f8f63b838af5467d4c95ba7b998b32 |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: Seated and flanked by nine other officers wearing uniforms representing all the different branches of the security forces, He also announced the dissolution of Constitution of Niger|the country's constitution, the suspension of all state institutions, the closure of the country's borders and a nationwide curfew from 22:00 until 05:00 local time, while warning against any foreign intervention. The curfew was later lifted on 4 August.

references.text: <ref name="bbc3"/> Abdramane said the defense and security forces had decided to topple the regime "due to the deteriorating security situation and bad governance."<ref name="reuters">{{cite web |last1=Aksar |first1=Moussa |last2=Balima |first2=Boureima |date=27 July 2023 |title=Niger soldiers say President Bazoum's government has been removed |url=https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/soldiers-nigers-presidential-guard-blockade-presidents-office-security-sources-2023-07-26/ |url-access=registration |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230726164404/https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/soldiers-nigers-presidential-guard-blockade-presidents-office-security-sources-2023-07-26/ |archive-date=26 July 2023 |access-date=26 July 2023 |website=Reuters}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite web |title=Soldiers in Niger claim to have overthrown President Mohamed Bazoum |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/7/26/soldiers-in-niger-claim-to-overthrow-mohamed-barzoums-government |access-date=27 July 2023 |website=Al Jazeera English|Al-Jazeera |archive-date=26 July 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230726235637/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/7/26/soldiers-in-niger-claim-to-overthrow-mohamed-barzoums-government |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref name="bbc2">{{cite web |last=Peter |first=Laurence |date=27 July 2023 |title=Niger soldiers announce coup on national TV |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-66320895 |access-date=27 July 2023 |website=BBC |archive-date=27 July 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230727000929/https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-66320895 |url-status=live }}</ref>
<ref>{{cite web |title=Niger junta lifts curfew in place since coup |url=https://english.ahram.org.eg/News/506019.aspx |date=4 August 2023 |website=Al-Ahram}}</ref>

sentences.text: In the morning, Bazoum tweeted that Nigeriens who love democracy would see to it that "hard-won gains will be safeguarded", indicating his refusal to step down from office. Massaoudou also declared himself acting head of state and called on all democrats to "make this adventure fail".<ref name="bbc2"/>

references.text: <ref name="bbc2"/> His foreign minister, Hassoumi Massaoudou, told France 24 that the country's "legal and legitimate power" remained with the President and reiterated that Bazoum was in good condition and that not the entire army was involved.<ref>{{cite web |date=27 July 2023 |title=Detained Niger president defiant after coup bid |url=https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20230726-presidency-sealed-off-in-coup-prone-niger |access-date=27 July 2023 |website=France 24 |archive-date=26 July 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230726172357/https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20230726-presidency-sealed-off-in-coup-prone-niger |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: Despite being detained, Bazoum has not resigned and has been able to get in contact with world leaders and officials such as French President Emmanuel Macron, UN Secretary-General António Guterres, AU Commissioner Moussa Faki, and US Secretary of State Antony Blinken. However, a former advisor to Bazoum who had been in contact with him said that the military was trying to wear him down by surrounding his residence with armored military vehicles, chaining the access gates shut and cutting the electricity supply. Subsequent reports indicated that he has been suffering from bad health while in captivity.

references.text: <ref>{{cite web |date=28 July 2023 |title=Soldiers Declare Niger General New Leader After Attempted Coup |url=https://www.voanews.com/a/macron-says-niger-s-bazoum-reachable-in-good-health-/7201644.html |access-date=29 July 2023 |website=VOA}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite web |date=27 July 2023 |title=Niger situation remains 'fluid' as army backs coup plotters |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/7/27/niger-situation-remains-fluid-as-army-backs-coup-plotters |access-date=29 July 2023 |website=Al Jazeera English|Aljazeera}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite web |date=28 July 2023 |title=Niger general appears on state TV as new leader following coup |url=https://www.cnn.com/2023/07/28/africa/niger-coup-general-state-tv-appearance-intl/ |access-date=11 August 2023 |website=CNN |first1=Eve |last1=Brennan |first2=Dalal |last2=Mawad |first3=Oliver |last3=Briscoe |first4=Martin |last4=Goillandeau}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite web |date=29 July 2023 |title=Blinken calls for immediate release of ousted Niger president |url=https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/blinken-calls-immediate-release-ousted-niger-president-2023-07-29/ |access-date=29 July 2023 |website=Reuters}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite web |first1= Jennifer |last1=Hauser |first2=Michael |last2=Conte |first3=Chris |last3=Lau |date=4 August 2023 |title=Niger's ousted president warns of 'devastating' coup impact, growing Russian influence |url=https://www.cnn.com/2023/08/04/africa/niger-president-mohamed-bazoum-hostage-oped-intl-hnk/ |access-date=11 August 2023 |website=CNN}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite news |last=Salih |first=Zeinab Mohammed |date=2023-08-11 |title=Niger's captive leader losing weight in inhumane conditions, daughter says |language=en-GB |work=The Guardian |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/aug/11/niger-captive-leader-losing-weight-in-inhumane-conditions-daughter-reveals-mohamed-bazoum |access-date=2023-08-11 |issn=0261-3077}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite web |last1=Habib |first1=Gift |title=Ousted Niger President Bazoum visited by his doctor |url=https://punchng.com/ousted-niger-president-bazoum-visited-by-his-doctor/ |website=The Punch |date=12 August 2023 |access-date=12 August 2023}}</ref>

sentences.text: The leadership of the Niger Armed Forces issued a statement signed by the army chief of staff, General Abdou Sidikou Issa, declaring its support for the coup. The statement mentioned the need to "preserve the physical integrity" of the President and his family and avoid "a deadly confrontation that could create a bloodbath and affect the security of the population."

references.text: <ref>{{cite web |date=27 July 2023 |title=Niger's army command declares support for military coup |url=https://france24.com/en/africa/20230727-niger-s-army-command-declares-support-for-military-coup |access-date=9 August 2023 |website=France 24 |archive-date=27 July 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230727142320/https://www.france24.com/en/africa/20230727-niger-s-army-command-declares-support-for-military-coup |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: In a television statement shortly after, Abdramane announced the suspension of all activities by List of political parties in Niger|political parties in the country until further notice. He also announced that the junta had issued a reprimand to France for violating the airspace closure after a military plane landed at an air base. Throughout the day, Télé Sahel continually broadcast the announcement of the junta's establishment with a few breaks in programming.<ref name="bbc3"/> The junta revoked military cooperation agreements with France, which has between 1,100 and 1,500 troops in the country.<ref name="reuters.com"/>

references.text: <ref>{{cite web |date=28 July 2023 |title=Niger army pledges allegiance to coup makers |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/7/27/nigerien-army-pledges-allegiance-to-coup-plotters |access-date=9 August 2023 |website=Al Jazeera English|Al Jazeera |archive-date=27 July 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230727142352/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/7/27/nigerien-army-pledges-allegiance-to-coup-plotters |url-status=live}}</ref>

sentences.text: A pro-coup demonstration took place with about 1,000 supporters The demonstrators also denounced the French presence and that of other foreign bases. Other demonstrators gathered outside the headquarters of Bazoum's PNDS-Tarayya party, with footage showing them stoning and setting fire to vehicles. They then subsequently ransacked and burned the premises, leading police to disperse them with tear gas. Demonstrations also occurred in front of the National Assembly (Niger)|National Assembly. This prompted the Interior Ministry in the evening to ban on all demonstrations with immediate effect. Civil servants were also told to stay home.

references.text: <ref name="f24tchiani"/> of the junta flying Russian flags, voicing support for the Wagner Group, and throwing rocks at a passing politician's vehicle.<ref name="ap2">{{Cite web|url=https://apnews.com/article/niger-mutinous-soldiers-attempted-coup-2efab1649bea7d89b14dbc9432f5f819|title=Niger's president vows democracy will prevail after mutinous soldiers detain him and declare a coup|date=27 July 2023|website=AP News|first=Sam|last=Mednick|access-date=27 July 2023|archive-date=27 July 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230727142327/https://apnews.com/article/niger-mutinous-soldiers-attempted-coup-2efab1649bea7d89b14dbc9432f5f819|url-status=live}}</ref>

sentences.text: General Abdourahamane Tchiani proclaimed himself as the president of the National Council for the Safeguard of the Homeland in an address on Télé Sahel. He said the coup was undertaken to avoid "the gradual and inevitable demise" of the country and said that Bazoum had tried to hide "the harsh reality" of the country, which he called "a pile of dead, displaced, humiliation and frustration". He also criticized the government's security strategy for its purported ineffectiveness and lack of collaboration with Mali and Burkina Faso but did not give a timeline for a return to civilian rule. His position as ''de facto'' concurrent head of state was later confirmed by Colonel Abdramane, who accused officials of Bazoum's government of plotting against the new regime while sheltering in foreign embassies and warned of bloodshed if they pushed through.

references.text: <ref name="f24tchiani">{{Cite web |work=France 24 |title=Niger's General Abdourahamane Tchiani declares himself leader after coup |date=28 July 2023 |url=https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20230728-niger-s-general-abdourahamane-tchiani-declared-new-leader-following-coup-state-tv |access-date=9 August 2023 |language=en-US}}</ref>
<ref>{{cite news |title=Niger coup: Abdourahmane Tchiani declares himself leader |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-66337767 |date=28 July 2023 |work=BBC |access-date=28 July 2023}}</ref>

<ref name="ajtchiani">{{cite news |title=Niger general Tchiani named head of transitional government after coup |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/7/28/niger-general-tchiani-named-head-of-transitional-government-after-coup |date=28 July 2023 |work=Al Jazeera |access-date=28 July 2023}}</ref>

sentences.text: Disruption within Niger following the coup has continued, with demonstrations, censorship of broadcasts and interruptions to power supplies, as well as evacuations of foreign nationals. The situation eventually escalated into a serious international crisis that has led to threats of military intervention by ECOWAS and heightened tensions and military mobilization in Niger.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-07-26 |title=African Union, ECOWAS condemn 'attempted coup d'état' in Niger |url=https://www.france24.com/en/africa/20230726-african-union-ecowas-condemn-attempted-coup-in-niger |access-date=2023-11-27 |website=France 24 |language=en}}</ref>

sentences.text: On 10 August, the junta declared a new government, naming 21 ministers led by Prime Minister Ali Lamine Zeine in an announcement on Télé Sahel by "secretary-general of the government" Mahamane Roufai Laouali. Three Generals who were members of the CNSP were named to head the Interior, Defense and Sports ministries.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |title=Niger military names 21-person cabinet ahead of key West African summit |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/8/10/niger-military-names-21-person-cabinet-ahead-of-west-african-summit |access-date=10 August 2023 |website=Al Jazeera |language=en}}</ref>

sentences.text: The heavy pressure from the international community and ECOWAS to hand over power, has prompted the junta to seek support from like-minded regimes in the region. On 2 August, a junta delegation headed by General Salifou Mody traveled to Bamako, Mali and then to Ouagadougou, Burkina Faso. On 12 August, a delegation from the putschists, led by General Moussa Salaou Barmou, visited Conakry to ask Guinea for support, and was received by the head of the Guinean junta, Mamady Doumbouya|Mamadi Doumbouya.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |date=2 August 2023 |title=Niger junta delegation arrives in Mali's Bamako |url=https://english.alarabiya.net/News/world/2023/08/02/Niger-junta-delegation-arrives-in-Mali-s-Bamako |access-date=2 August 2023 |website=Al-Arabiya |language=en}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |last=APA-Niamey (Niger) |date=2 August 2023 |title=Niger : un haut responsable du CNSP à Bamako |url=https://fr.apanews.net/now/niger-un-haut-responsable-du-cnsp-a-bamako/ |access-date=2 August 2023 |website=APAnews – Agence de Presse Africaine |language=fr-FR}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |last=RFI |date=2023-08-13 |title=Niger: la junte de Niamey demande du soutien à la Guinée |url=https://www.rfi.fr/fr/afrique/20230813-niger-la-junte-de-niamey-demande-du-soutien-%C3%A0-la-guin%C3%A9e |access-date= |website=Radio France Internationale |language=fr}}</ref>

sentences.text: On 13 August, the junta announced that it would prosecute Bazoum for "high treason" and "undermining the country's security".

references.text: <ref>{{cite news |title=Niger military regime says will 'prosecute' president Bazoum for 'high treason' |url=https://english.alarabiya.net/News/world/2023/08/14/Niger-military-regime-says-will-prosecute-president-Bazoum-for-high-treason- |access-date=14 August 2023 |work=al-Arabiya|date=13 August 2023}}</ref>

sentences.text: On 20 August, Tchiani promised to return Niger to civilian rule within three years after meeting ECOWAS mediators in Niamey.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite news |date=2023-08-20 |title=Niger coup leader Gen Tchiani promises to handover power in three years |language=en-GB |work=BBC News |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-66562765 |access-date=2023-08-20}}</ref>

sentences.text: On 22 August, the African Union suspended Niger from the bloc and told its members to avoid any action that might legitimize the junta.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite news |date=2023-08-22 |title=African Union suspends Niger over coup |language=en |work=Reuters |url=https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/african-union-suspends-niger-all-its-activities-following-coup-2023-08-22/ |access-date=2023-08-22}}</ref>

sentences.text: The junta gradually reopened Niger's borders, starting with crossings to Algeria, Burkina Faso, Mali, Libya, and Chad on 1 August, followed by its airspace on 4 September.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite news |date=2 August 2023 |title=Niger reopens borders with several neighbours a week after coup |language=en |work=Reuters |url=https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/niger-reopens-borders-with-several-neighbours-week-after-coup-2023-08-02/ |access-date=2 August 2023 |archive-date=2 August 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230802083529/https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/niger-reopens-borders-with-several-neighbours-week-after-coup-2023-08-02/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: On 24 September, French President Emmanuel Macron announced France was French military withdrawal from West Africa (2022–present)|pulling its troops as well as diplomatic staff, including its ambassador Sylvain Itté, from Niger by the end of 2023. Prior to this, Itté had defied the junta's demand for his expulsion, which led to a total blockade of the French embassy in Niamey.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |title=France to withdraw ambassador, troops from Niger after coup: Macron |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/9/24/france-to-withdraw-ambassador-troops-from-niger-after-coup-macron |access-date=2023-09-24 |website=www.aljazeera.com |language=en}}</ref>

sentences.text: Niger's governing political coalition denounced the coup as "a suicidal and anti-republican madness", while the opposition coalition expressed support for the military's grievances but disapproved of any political changes through force. also expressed his support for the President and welcomed the imposition of sanctions by ECOWAS on the military junta as "very satisfactory and logical", while insisting that anti-French demonstrations in Niamey did not represent the Nigerien people as a whole.

<ref name="f24tchiani" /> Two deputy officials of Bazoum's cabinet, Daouda Takoubakoye and Oumar Moussa, said Tchiani's statements on the coup were "lies" and accused him and the presidential guard of staging the coup for "personal gain".<ref name="gulf2"/> Bazoum's Prime Minister, Ouhoumoudou Mahamadou, who was in Europe at the time of the coup,<ref>{{Cite web |first=Kathryn |last=Armstrong |date=8 August 2023 |title=Niger coup: Wagner taking advantage of instability – Antony Blinken |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-66436797 |access-date=8 August 2023 |website=BBC}}</ref>

sentences.text: The coup was condemned by the World Bank, the African Union, the Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS), the United Nations, Algeria, the European Union, France, and the United States; several of them, as well as the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights Volker Türk have called for Bazoum's immediate release. On 2 August, the World Bank suspended disbursements to Niger until further notice.

sentences.text: On 30 July, ECOWAS gave Niger's coup leaders a one-week deadline to hand power back to Bazoum or to face international sanctions and/or use of force. On the same day, ECOWAS leaders said they would immediately enforce a no-fly zone over the country for all commercial flights, and a closure of borders with Niger. A series of sanctions was also announced, including the suspension of all commercial and financial transactions between its member states and Niger and the freezing of assets and travel restrictions for military personnel involved in the coup. A planned 30 billion CFA franc ($51 million) bond issuance by Niger scheduled for 31 July in the West African regional debt market was cancelled by the Central Bank of West African States (BCEAO). Following the expiration of its deadline on Bazoum's restoration, ECOWAS ordered the "immediate activation" of its intervention force, but said it still favors a peaceful resolution to the crisis. On 18 August, ECOWAS said it had agreed an undisclosed "D-Day" for a possible military intervention to restore democracy in Niger if diplomatic efforts fail, stressing that it would not hold endless dialogue with the junta.

sentences.text: Benin's President Patrice Talon called the coup a "military misbehavior". Kenyan President William Ruto called the coup a "serious setback" for Africa.

references.text: <ref name="held by guards">{{cite web |date=26 July 2023 |title=Niger's Bazoum 'held by guards' in apparent coup attempt |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/7/26/soldiers-holding-niger-president-inside-palace-security-sources |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230727002123/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/7/26/soldiers-holding-niger-president-inside-palace-security-sources |archive-date=27 July 2023 |access-date=27 July 2023 |website=Al Jazeera |language=en-US}}</ref>

<ref name="gulf2"/> South Africa also condemned and called on the junta to ensure Bazoum's safety and urgently return to constitutional rule.<ref>{{Cite web |title=South Africa condemn the coup d'état in the Republic of Niger |url=https://www.dirco.gov.za/south-africa-condemns-the-coup-detat-in-the-republic-of-niger/ |website=Department of International Relations and Cooperation}}</ref>

sentences.text: The United States formally referred to the coup as "an effort to seize power by force and to disrupt the constitution," stopping short of describing it as a coup, as doing so would entail a withdrawal of economic aid and military assistance, including existing drone and military bases, to the nation. It expressed support for ECOWAS and warned the junta against harming Bazoum and those detained with him, stressing that it would hold them responsible for such an action. On 15 August, a The Pentagon|Pentagon spokesperson referred to the events as an "attempted coup".

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |last=Kelemen |first=Michele |date=27 July 2023 |title=Here's why Niger's coup matters to the U.S. |url=https://www.npr.org/2023/07/27/1190463279/niger-coup-us-counterterrorism-boko-haram-isis |access-date=28 July 2023 |website=NPR}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite news |date=11 August 2023 |title=US warns military junta in Niger not to harm detained president safety |work=Gulf Times |url=https://www.gulf-times.com/article/666249/international/us-warns-military-junta-in-niger-not-to-harm-detained-president-safety |access-date=11 August 2023}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite web |last1=Singh |first1=Sabrina |title=Pentagon: Situation in Niger "Looks Like An Attempted Coup" |url=https://www.c-span.org/video/?c5081516/pentagon-situation-niger-looks-attempted-coup |access-date=15 August 2023 |website=C-SPAN}}</ref>

sentences.text: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China|Chinese foreign ministry expressed support for Bazoum and called for a diplomatic resolution to the crisis but did not directly condemn the coup or refer to the event as one.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |date=3 August 2023 |title=China hopes Niger will find a 'political resolution' to coup |url=https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/china-hopes-niger-will-find-political-resolution-coup-2023-08-03/ |url-access=limited |access-date=9 August 2023 |work=Reuters}}</ref>

sentences.text: The EU and France withheld financial and development aid to Niger and suspended all security cooperation agreements with the country. France stated that it continued to recognize Bazoum as the "sole president" of Niger.

references.text: <ref name="aueu2">{{Cite web |date=29 July 2023 |title=EU, African Union escalate pressure on Niger's coup leaders |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/7/29/blinken-offers-nigers-ousted-leader-bazoum-unflagging-support |access-date=29 July 2023 |website=Al Jazeera}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |date=29 July 2023 |title=France cuts off aid to Niger amid growing Western condemnation of coup |url=https://www.france24.com/en/africa/20230729-france-cuts-off-aid-to-niger-amid-growing-western-condemnation-of-coup |access-date=29 July 2023 |website=France 24}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |date=28 July 2023 |title=Niger coup: Army general warns against foreign intervention |url=https://punchng.com/niger-coup-army-general-warns-against-foreign-intervention/ |access-date=29 July 2023 |work=The Punch}}</ref>

sentences.text: Yevgeny Prigozhin, the head of the Russian private mercenary Wagner Group that has operated in neighboring Mali and supplanted France in combating the country's own Mali War|jihadist insurgency, praised the coup and called it part of Niger's fight against its "Neocolonialism|colonizers." while subsequently criticizing intervention by non-regional forces as "ineffective." Mykhailo Podolyak, an adviser to Ukraine|Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, alleged that Russia was behind the coup in Niger.

references.text: <ref name="ap22" /> Prigozhin's statements contrasted with the official line given by the Russian government, with President Vladimir Putin's spokesperson Dmitry Peskov calling the coup a "serious concern" and calling for all sides "to show restraint" and for "the fastest possible return to legal order,"<ref>{{Cite web |date=31 July 2023 |title=Situation in Niger is 'cause for serious concern', says Kremlin |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/7/31/situation-in-niger-is-cause-for-serious-concern-says-kremlin |access-date=31 July 2023 |work=Al Jazeera English|Aljazeera}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |date=4 August 2023 |title=Kremlin says interference of non-regional actors unlikely to help Niger |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/8/4/kremlin-says-interference-of-non-regional-actors-unlikely-to-help-niger |access-date=5 August 2023 |work=Al Jazeera English|Aljazeera}}</ref>

<ref name="Myk2">{{cite news |date=1 August 2023 |title=Russia responsible for Niger coup, says top Ukrainian official |agency=Al Jazeera English|Al Jazeera |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/8/1/russia-responsible-for-niger-coup-says-top-ukrainian-official |access-date=1 August 2023}}</ref>

sentences.text: The UN announced that it had suspended its humanitarian operations in the country, Meanwhile, the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) led by Nnamdi Kanu declared their support for the coup, hailing the coup plotters for fighting against neo-colonialism and imperialism.{{Citation needed|date=September 2024}}

references.text: <ref name="BBC_HQ2" /> but later clarified that it was still delivering aid to Niger but was not in contact with the military.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Nicholls |first=Michele |date=29 July 2023 |title=UN still delivering aid in Niger, no contact with military |url=https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/un-still-delivering-aid-niger-no-contact-with-military-2023-07-28/ |access-date=29 July 2023 |website=Reuters}}</ref>

sentences.text: The military junta of Myanmar expressed support for the coup.

references.text: <ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.irrawaddy.com/news/burma/myanmar-junta-declares-support-for-niger-military-coup.html | title=Myanmar Junta Declares Support for Niger Military Coup | date=21 August 2023 }}</ref>

sentences.text: At the time of the coup, a major oil pipeline that would be the longest in Africa at 1,980 kilometers in length was under construction. It would connect the oil fields of the Agadem oasis, in the Erg of Bilma, in Diffa Region|Diffa, Niger with the Port Seme Terminal in Benin. By October 2022, 30% of the pipeline was complete. Benin authorities commented that the sanctions imposed on Niger by ECOWAS after the coup, although they did not stop construction work, could mean a significant delay. The Trans-Saharan gas pipeline connecting Europe and Nigeria was still being planned at the time of the coup.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.nsenergybusiness.com/projects/niger-benin-crude-pipeline/# |title=Niger-Benin Crude Pipeline |work=www.nsenergybusiness.com |access-date=5 August 2023}}</ref>
